thread.title: EPL: Gunners move atop table for first time in 20 months
thread.title_full: EPL: Gunners move atop table for first time in 20 months

title: EPL: Gunners move atop table for first time in 20 months
text:
EPL: Gunners move atop table for first time in 20 months 
CCTV.com Share this: Share on twitter Share on facebook Share on sinaweibo Share on email Font size: 
Arsenal were at home to Everton. The Gunners were looking to use the momentum from Tuesday's 2-0 win over Bayern Munich in the UEFA Champions League to fuel further success in their domestic campaign, as a win here would see them go to the top of the table for the first time in 20 months. Arsenal 2 - Everton 1 
In the 36th minute, Mesut Ozil's cross finds Olivier Giroud, who nods it in to make it 1-0 for the hosts. And the Gunners would double the lead two minutes later, as Santi Cazorla takes a free kick from the left, and Laurent Koscielny heads it in. 
Everton get back in the contest just before half-time, when Ross Barkley's effort deflects in. 2-1 is the final score, and the victory sees Arsenal go to the top of the Premier League table for the first time since February 2014. Arsenal 2 - Everton 1 
West Ham heaped more misery on Chelsea winning 2-1 as Jose Mourinho was sent off, Swansea edged Aston Villa 2-1, Leicester topped Crystal Palace 1-0, Stoke lost to Watford 2-0, and Norwich fell to West Brom 1-0. 
Robben scores in return from injury sustained in September 
Bayern Munich winger Arjen Robben would sparkle in his comeback, after spending nearly two months out injured. In the 35th minute, the Dutchman breaks into the area and slots home, to open the scoring for the German champions. 
Arturo Vidal, Robert Lewandowski, and Thomas Muller also get on the scoresheet, as the Bavarians beat the Billy Goats 4-0. This win marks the team's 1,000th victory in the Bundesliga, and put them 10 points clear at the top of the table. 
Elsewhere, Bayer Leverkusen bounced back from a 2-0 deficit to beat Stuttgart 4-3. Werder Bremen snapped a five-game losing streak with a 3-1 victory over Mainz. Frankfurt beat Hannover 2-1. And Hertha Berlin remained in fifth place after a 1-0 win over Ingolstadt. 
Victory gives Los Blancos three-point lead atop table 
In the Spanish La Liga, Real Madrid would travel to Celta Vigo, which is where forward Cristiano Ronaldo and fullback Danilo both strike early, putting the visitors in control. 
Marcelo later has to clear a Nolito effort off the line in the 72nd minute. But Real hold firm as Marcelo scores with the last kick of the match, in the sixth minute of stoppage time, making it 3-1. Elsewhere, Sevilla defeated Getafe 5-0 while Granada drew with Real Betis 1-1 and Malaga beat Deportivo 2-0. Related Videos
